contextId.information: This implies someone went to the jail. AT: "sent someone to the jail to bring the apostles" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: sent to the jail to have the apostles brought

contextId.information: Here the word "it" refers to "this plan or work." AT: "if God has devised this plan or commanded these men to do this work" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to add more information. AT: "the ministry of teaching and preaching the word" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
"and Jacob became the father." Stephen shortened this. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to your audience to add in the missing information. AT: Is the prophet speaking of himself, or is he speaking of some other person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

Peter leaves out some things to keep the story short. AT: "the Holy Spirit came on the Gentile believers, just as he came on the Jewish believers at Pentecost" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: the Holy Spirit came on them, just as on us in the beginning

contextId.information: The second group mentioned agreed with the message about grace. It may be helpful to restate the verb. AT: "sided with the apostles" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The words "in Christ" are understood. AT: "who believed in Christ" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
Paul taught people in various private homes. The words "I taught" are understood. AT: "and I also taught when I was in your homes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The words "about me" are understood. AT: "bear witness about me in Rome" or "testify about me in Rome" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
